```{r tidy_data}
hri.emer <- hri.emer.raw$tableResult %>%
  filter(hatchingId == -1) %>%  # Filter out "Unstable" points of data
  select(geo, geoId, year, dataValue) %>%
  rename(state           = geo,
         state.id        = geoId,
         emer.per.capita = dataValue) %>%
  mutate(state.id        = as.numeric(state.id),
         year            = as.numeric(year),
         emer.per.capita = as.numeric(emer.per.capita))

hri.hosp <- hri.hosp.raw$tableResult %>%
  filter(hatchingId == -1) %>%  # Filter out "Unstable" points of data
  select(geo, geoId, year, dataValue) %>%
  rename(state           = geo,
         state.id        = geoId,
         hosp.per.capita = dataValue) %>%
  mutate(state.id        = as.numeric(state.id),
         year            = as.numeric(year),
         hosp.per.capita = as.numeric(hosp.per.capita))

hri.mort <- hri.mort.raw$tableResult %>%
  filter(suppressionFlag == 0) %>% # Filter out "Suppressed" points of data
  select(geo, geoId, year, dataValue) %>%
  rename(state             = geo,
         state.id          = geoId,
         mortalities.total = dataValue) %>%
  mutate(state.id          = as.numeric(state.id),
         year              = as.numeric(year),
         mortalities.total = as.numeric(mortalities.total))

co2 <- co2.raw %>%
  filter(Unit == "Parts Per Million") %>%
  select(Date, Value) %>%
  rename(date = Date,
         ppm  = Value) %>%
  mutate(date = str_replace(date, "M", "-"),
         date = paste0(date, '-01'),
         date = as.Date(date)) %>%
  filter(date >= as.Date("2000-01-01"))
```

```{r}
poly_smooth <- function(data, degree, x_var, y_var) {
  data[[x_var]] <- as.numeric(data[[x_var]])
  data[[y_var]] <- as.numeric(data[[y_var]])

  # Check if there are enough unique points for the specified degree
  if (length(unique(data[[x_var]])) <= degree) {
    stop("'degree' must be less than the number of unique points.")
  }

  model <- lm(data[[y_var]] ~ poly(data[[x_var]], degree), data = data)
  
  newdata <- data.frame(x = seq(min(data[[x_var]]), max(data[[x_var]]), length.out = 100))
  newdata[[y_var]] <- predict(model, newdata = data.frame(x = newdata$x))
  
  return(newdata)
}

poly_smooth_hri_emer <- poly_smooth(merge(co2, hri.emer, by.x = "date", by.y = "year"), 2, "ppm", "emer.per.capita")
poly_smooth_hri_hosp <- poly_smooth(merge(co2, hri.hosp, by.x = "date", by.y = "year"), 2, "ppm", "hosp.per.capita")
poly_smooth_hri_mort <- poly_smooth(merge(co2, hri.mort, by.x = "date", by.y = "year"), 2, "ppm", "mortalities.total")

# Combine all datasets in one graph
ggplot() +
  geom_point(data = co2, aes(ppm, Value), color = "purple") +
  geom_line(data = poly_smooth_hri_emer, aes(x, emer.per.capita), color = "red", linetype = "solid") +
  geom_line(data = poly_smooth_hri_hosp, aes(x, hosp.per.capita), color = "blue", linetype = "solid") +
  geom_line(data = poly_smooth_hri_mort, aes(x, mortalities.total), color = "green", linetype = "solid") +
  labs(title = "Polynomial Regression",
       subtitle = "Combined Graph for Multiple Datasets",
       x = "PPM (Parts Per Million)",
       y = "Variable Value",
       color = "Dataset") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("red", "blue", "green", "purple"))
```
